body:
Feels like the folder does not exist. If you refresh the UI is it still there?

Can you post the full log of starting syncthing, and trying to remove the folder, as well as your config?
When I say `Feels like the folder does not exist`, I mean in the config. And the UI is somehow trying to delete a non-existing folder.

@AudriusButkevicius config for this folder:
```
    <folder id="hm7kz-6fcmw" label="" path="/home/vasya/hm7kz-6fcmw" type="readwrite" rescanIntervalS="60" ignorePerms="false" autoNormalize="true">
        <filesystemType>basic</filesystemType>
        <device id="SANITIZED" introducedBy=""></device>
        <minDiskFree unit="%">1</minDiskFree>
        <versioning></versioning>
        <copiers>0</copiers>
        <pullers>0</pullers>
        <hashers>0</hashers>
        <order>random</order>
        <ignoreDelete>false</ignoreDelete>
        <scanProgressIntervalS>0</scanProgressIntervalS>
        <pullerSleepS>0</pullerSleepS>
        <pullerPauseS>0</pullerPauseS>
        <maxConflicts>10</maxConflicts>
        <disableSparseFiles>false</disableSparseFiles>
        <disableTempIndexes>false</disableTempIndexes>
        <paused>true</paused>
        <weakHashThresholdPct>25</weakHashThresholdPct>
    </folder>
```
I sanitized device ID, left everything else untouched. BTW, I've made a couple of clicks "rescan all" during my session. Also, it was (still is) the first session I run syncthing at all on my computer.
Can you start syncthing, try to remove the folder and just post the full log?

@AudriusButkevicius  Full log from start to panic message:
```
syncthing 
[monitor] 15:41:44 INFO: Starting syncthing
[NW274] 15:41:44 INFO: syncthing v0.14.37 "Dysprosium Dragonfly" (go1.9 linux-amd64) builduser@svetlemodry 2017-09-06 17:09:47 UTC [noupgrade]
[NW274] 15:41:44 INFO: My ID: SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:45 INFO: Single thread SHA256 performance is 428 MB/s using minio/sha256-simd (364 MB/s using crypto/sha256).
[NW274] 15:41:45 INFO: Hashing performance with weak hash is 347.98 MB/s
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Hashing performance without weak hash is 419.88 MB/s
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Weak hash enabled, as it has an acceptable performance impact.
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Ready to synchronize "phoneSync" (fy61h-2828l) (readwrite)
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Send rate is unlimited, receive rate is unlimited
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Rate limits do not apply to LAN connections
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Using discovery server https://discovery-v4-2.syncthing.net/v2/?id=SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Using discovery server https://discovery-v4-3.syncthing.net/v2/?id=SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: TCP listener ([::]:22000) starting
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Listing network interfaces: route ip+net: netlinkrib: operation not supported
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Detected 0 NAT devices
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Completed initial scan (rw) of "phoneSync" (fy61h-2828l)
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Using discovery server https://discovery-v4-4.syncthing.net/v2/?id=SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Using discovery server https://discovery-v6-2.syncthing.net/v2/?id=SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Using discovery server https://discovery-v6-3.syncthing.net/v2/?id=SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Using discovery server https://discovery-v6-4.syncthing.net/v2/?id=SANITIZED
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: GUI and API listening on 127.0.0.1:8384
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Access the GUI via the following URL: http://127.0.0.1:8384/
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Device  is "notebook" at [dynamic]
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Device SANITIZED is "phone6p" at [dynamic]
[NW274] 15:41:46 INFO: Device SANITIZED is "vn971think" at [dynamic]
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[monitor] 15:41:59 WARNING: Panic detected, writing to "/home/vasya/.config/syncthing/panic-20170909-154159.log"
[monitor] 15:41:59 WARNING: Please check for existing issues with similar panic message at https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/
[monitor] 15:41:59 WARNING: If no issue with similar panic message exists, please create a new issue with the panic log attached
[monitor] 15:41:59 INFO: Syncthing exited: exit status 2
[monitor] 15:42:00 INFO: Starting syncthing
[NW274] 15:42:00 INFO: syncthing v0.14.37 "Dysprosium Dragonfly" (go1.9 linux-amd64) builduser@svetlemodry 2017-09-06 17:09:47 UTC [noupgrade]
```

rename.from: syncthing daemon gets SIGSEGV panic errors

rename.to: SIGSEGV panic errors on folder delete

body: Right, it seems the bug exists because the folder is paused.
I suspect if you unpause it and remove it, it should work as expected.

@AudriusButkevicius Confirmed: folder deleted successfully after being unpaused.

// I thought about it too (since it's paused, maybe it has something unassingned/null).

offtopic: this is why I like languages that discourage the usage of nulls (no, Go and Java, not you).

Anyway, thanks!

I have the same issue.

I un-paused, then I was able to delete the folder.
@croqaz maybe you use an older version, not one compiled from master?
